8.Name: Traction
8.Desc: Pulls targets within range towards a specific position

15.Name: Aero DMG Amplification
15.Desc: Provides Aero DMG Amplification for a specific Resonator in the team

24.Name: Aero Erosion
24.Desc: Utilizes Aero Erosion for combat advantage

Name: Cartethyia
Desc: Cartethyia, the wandering knight who travels across <te href=850096>Rinascita</te>. Formerly known as the Blessed Maiden, the vessel of Divinity, and the Queen of Gale and Tide, she went by the name Fleurdelys. Now, she is simply a free and unfettered wandering knight.

CharaInfo.Info: Cartethyia, the wandering knight who travels across <te href=850096>Rinascita</te>. Formerly known as the Blessed Maiden, the vessel of Divinity, and the Queen of Gale and Tide, she went by the name Fleurdelys. Now, she is simply a free and unfettered wandering knight.
CharaInfo.TalentDoc: [Resonance Evaluation Report RA-X006] Time of Awakening unknown. It is speculated that due to the opposing influences exerted by Sentinel Imperator and Threnodian Leviathan, Cartethyia's Spectrum Performance data exceeds standard values by ▇▇▇▇▇▇▇. Calculation of accurate data using existing methods is impossible. Analysis of test samples has revealed a non-convergent Rabelle's Curve with a pronounced periodic waveform. Therefore, Cartethyia is classified as a Congenital Resonator. System has classified Cartethyia as a unique subject. Her file has been sealed under a special project group. Access clearance: ▇▇▇ System will conduct continuous monitoring of Cartethyia.
CharaInfo.TalentCertification: Cartethyia's waveform graph shows elliptical fluctuations with a stable Time Domain. Peak values between upper and lower bounds show intermittent upward trends, with peak values not yet exceeding critical threshold. No abnormal fluctuations have been observed. External and internal forces within Cartethyia have nearly reached a state of fusion. Resonant Criticality: High. Stability is high with minimal risk of Overclocking. However, it is worth noting that Cartethyia's body shows unstable power fluctuations when distant from Rinascita. Cartethyia is a rare individual who has undergone a Second Awakening, enabling her to transition freely between two forms. It must be emphasized that this is not a case of Overclocking, but rather the precise invocation of her powers. Note from a Bloom Bearer: When Miss Cartethyia... No, wait, Fleurdelys, demonstrated her powers, the storm nearly tore the entire simulation apart! My, oh, my. We gotta take extra precautions with our next test!

Stories.Title: The Knight's Faded Hours
Stories.Content:
A retired dramatist enjoys telling a certain story: Once upon a time, in the countryside of Egla Town, there was a wandering knight. With sword in hand, he journeyed far and wide in search of a legendary giant. A giant who stood as tall as a windmill, with arms long and slender like its blades. Time after time, the wandering knight fought with everything he had against the giant, but the giant never spoke a word, only ever waving its arms, rendering the knight's attacks futile.

Some mocked the knight's foolishness, some pitied his delusion. After all, that so-called giant was nothing more than a windmill, and his battles were but a fantasy. But the countryside's most mischievous girl saw it differently.

She found herself a knight's helmet and begged the dramatist for a small wooden sword. "To fight for such a giant," she said, "he must possess a heart of pure nobility." And so, she too wished to be like the knight, to seek out the giant who destroyed homes and scattered livestock, and see that the Golden Thiefbats lurking along roads could no longer steal a single treasure from travelers.

Riding flamboyantly on a Tumbleyak, she raced through the wheat fields. The world had never felt so vast. This was where the Blessed Maiden's legends began. Through the fields, through the festivities, and into the Inverted Tower.

It would be a grand quest.

Stories.Title: Steadfast in the Final Dance
Stories.Content:
This quest continued for some time.

In those unnoticed moments, the girl visited every field in Whisperwind Haven. Mischievous and free-spirited by nature, she even stole sips of sacramental wine under the watch of guards, danced away on high platforms, and turned a solemn ceremony into complete madness. Even the Order's prison walls became her personal canvas.

"She's really the most rambunctious girl in the countryside," people would say. "A serious fate isn't one she's meant for, and no wall, no matter how strong, could ever keep her from spreading her wings."

Yet to everyone's surprise, she was chosen by the Divinity.

Why her? Some questioned. She was only the daughter of an official, a peasant girl lacking discipline! Not a drop of noble blood ran in her veins. How would she ever come to understand the hierarchies of the world?

"She is the one!" others exclaimed. "She listens to our sorrows and replaces them with joy! If anyone is worthy of Divinity's crown, it is her."

But what would the one bearing the name Fleurdelys think of all this? Before the ceremony to receive her holy name, in a dull and stuffy hall, she performed her final dance as Cartethyia.

Was she confused by Divinity's whispers? Fearful of an uncertain future? Confident that she could wield the sacred sword?

She simply kept the name "Cartethyia" hidden deep within her heart. Farewell, grain fields swaying in the breeze, and the Tumbleyaks roaming so free. In a world so vast, someone must take up the sword. Someone must bind themselves in thorns. Someone must accept the weight of responsibilities. Someone—

Must become Fleurdelys, the guardian of <te href=850096>Rinascita</te>.

Stories.Title: Hesitation Amid Gale and Tide
Stories.Content:
As Fleurdelys, she must march to war with a sword in hand.

For this, she learned everything she could. She studied Order scriptures and honed her combat skills. She listened to the voices of the people, devoting herself to fulfilling their wishes. When someone prayed for good health, she arranged for the delivery of valuable medicines. When someone sought peace, she would listen to their confessions, taking in their past sorrows. When a <te href=850081>Tacet Discord</te> Outbreak occurred, she drew her sword and crushed it in its infancy. These actions were no different from what she had done back home.

The only difference was that she was no longer facing a small village or familiar faces. Most of those seeking her help were strangers, and she understood that each of them was like a small lamp. The more she helped, the more they would shine in the night sky of <te href=850096>Rinascita</te>.

Yet, the world was so vast, and the Order was far from flawless, as the books had claimed. The nobility were fixated only on their own interests, and self-proclaimed devout Acolytes merely performed their faith, turning a blind eye to the people's cries. She saw nobles who boasted of their good hearts while stuffing their pockets, refusing to hear the pleas of those suffering.

At times like these, all she could do was tighten her grip on her sword.

She experienced doubt, disturbance, and disappointment. And because of this, her grip only tightened as she faced the Dark Tide—She would question the Divinity. She must.

No matter the answer that awaited her, Fleurdelys was ready for it.

With this resolve, she walked into the tower. Alone.

Stories.Title: Yet Within Solitude
Stories.Content:
She seemed to have dreamed for a very long time.

In that dream, hymns and praises poured toward her in endless waves, engulfing her. She raised her sword to cut through the waves again and again, battling the giant sea creature in those waters. She fought with all her might. Even when the waters turned into blades sharp enough to slice flesh, she did not take a single step back.

When she opened her eyes, she found herself alone in an unfamiliar place.

Where was she? What was her purpose? Who was she? Questions whose answers had slipped beyond memory.

She wandered the tower in search of what was lost. She even tried to find a way into the central tower to seek answers. But after exploring every corner she could reach, she found nothing but herself. There was no "other" existence. She was the only soul there.

So she began to converse with herself. She stitched dolls from scraps. She invented stories.

Curiously, the fog of her memories began to lift, little by little, beneath her fingertips.

She made one doll of a sword-wielding girl and another of a sea monster. She muttered a few lines of dialogue between them, then paused. She knew this story. She'd heard it before. The <ano=wandering knight>sword-wielding girl</ano> had journeyed to confront the terrifying <ano=sea monster>giant</ano> of legend. Time and time again, she fought it with everything she had. 

No matter what the <ano=wandering knight>sword-wielding girl</ano> was fighting for, she understood one thing—

Each time she raised her sword, she did not care about her past. She only cared about what needed to be done at that very moment.

And if that were true, then losing her memories was no great loss. In a world so vast, she would find herself again.

And when that time comes, whether she turns out to be the warrior or the monster, it's an answer she would be willing to accept.

Stories.Title: The Wandering Knight Marches To Freedom
Stories.Content:
Inside a small restaurant in Whisperwind Haven, a young girl orders several Laurus Salads. While waiting for her food, she quietly sneaks into the kitchen, following the head chef and carefully observing her culinary techniques.

"Hmm. A few more of these Viscum Berries, please. Ah, yes, yes. And another!"

"You can add more honey as well... Yes, thank you!"

"And where did you come from, little rascal? If you're waiting for your food, you need to wait outside." The head chef puts down her utensils and looks up, pausing in astonishment. The girl before her seems familiar, but she can't quite place a name.

"I-I'm so sorry! I just wanted to pick up some of your cooking skills. I have a long journey ahead of me, and I might not have the fortune to come across a restaurant serving such delicious food again. If my apology isn't enough, I'll chop some firewood for you instead."

"Is this your first time eating at our restaurant? I have a feeling I've seen you before." The head chef hands the curious girl her food. 

"Was it from that stained glass window...?"

"This isn't my first time, actually! But it's been quite a while since I last visited," the girl replies, taking the plate. "Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Cartethyia. I'm a wandering knight preparing for a new quest. If you ever need help, do let me know."

"I just had to try this before I begin my journey!" The girl scoops up a spoonful of salad and takes a bite.

In a world so vast, a salad full of Viscum Berries made the beginning of her journey feel just right.

"How delicious." She praises from her heart.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: I
Voices.Content: Here, this is for you. Be careful, it's just been baked and is still hot. But trust me, it tastes best when you tear into it right away. This little trick is just for you, since we're good friends. Coming back home feels different, even though my house has been empty for so long. But the bread from that bakery still tastes the same. The last time I had it was when I won the <te href=850103>Laurel</te> as the Blessed Maiden. Back then, the town was covered in posters of me dancing at the <te href=850102>Carnevale</te>. That dance... would you like to see it?

Voices.Title: Thoughts: II
Voices.Content: ...Back in the tower, I felt uneasy just hearing you mention it... but actually hearing a play about my life was utterly surreal. If you hadn't stopped me, I'd have jumped out of my seat and run away! When I was younger, I used to daydream about being the heroine in one of those adventure stories. But now that it's actually happening, it's nothing like I imagined. The poets of <te href=850097>Ragunna</te> have added so many embellishments. If they'd checked my scripture grades from the seminary, they wouldn't have written those extravagant lines about me.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: III
Voices.Content: We meet again, Righteous One. Heh... So, how was I? Was I helpful? I'm no longer the lost, confused girl I once was. Now, I stand ready to fight alongside you. This is the promise I made, and to honor it, I will sharpen this sword even further. Though it may never come to pass, if fate wills it... I will defeat you as I vowed... and set you right.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: IV
Voices.Content: After merging Fleurdelys, I finally understood why I hesitated when "I" first saw you as I danced on the water's surface. When you first arrived in <te href=850096>Rinascita</te>, "I" could feel your presence. A strange joy surged through "me." Deep within the tower, "I" wondered… what would the one who could both destroy and liberate "me" look like? Would you be a righteous knight, as in the legends, slaying "me" with your sword? I couldn't choose how I was born, but I could choose how I would die. And that, in itself, is a kind of happiness. You gave "me" that chance, "Godkiller." And the ending of this story is more beautiful than I ever imagined.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: V
Voices.Content: The turmoil in <te href=850096>Rinascita</te> is far from over. Born of mankind's ill will, Leviathan may yet rise from the raging currents of civilization's soul... I cannot stray too far from this land. Everyone has their limits, often bound by responsibility, and true freedom remains elusive. You and I are no exceptions. But the sword you wield was forged from our shared frequencies. It is a mark of our bond and a manifestation of my power. As long as you carry it, I will be your sword and faithful companion... ever present in the depths of your gaze.

Voices.Title: Cartethyia's Hobby
Voices.Content: I love seeing people smile! That’s why I adore the <te href=850102>Carnevale</te> and any lively occasion. The cheerful crowds, the joy in the air, the laughter filling every corner... I just love being part of it. Whenever that happens, I want to blend into the crowd, singing, dancing, and spinning hand in hand with everyone...

Voices.Title: Cartethyia's Trouble
Voices.Content: ...Whenever I transform into Fleurdelys for battle, I have to constantly remind myself—My manners, my tone... everything has to be composed and solemn... Ah! It's actually really hard, you know? Truly!

Voices.Title: Favorite Food
Voices.Content: My favorite dish is Laurus Salad, of course. It's not only delicious, it's also healthy. I'd gladly eat it for three meals straight. Hm? Oh, I wouldn't get tired of it, not at all! The sweet Viscum Berries coated in dressing have the perfect crunch and flavor. It's easy to prepare, and even I can make the dish taste just right.

Voices.Title: Disliked Food
Voices.Content: I'm not really fond of fish. I don't know why, but every time I try to eat it, I just can't, even my fingertips seem to resist. When I was little, my parents used to say I was picky. Living by the sea, there aren't many food choices, especially if you don't like fish. But I've never been able to get over this instinctive aversion.

Voices.Title: Ideals
Voices.Content: My current dream? I want to be a wandering knight, just like the ones in the stories passed down in Egla Town. A knight of righteousness, always ready to draw my sword in the face of injustice, then riding off in the most heroic way! Before the Order chose me to be the Blessed Maiden, that was my deepest wish. But now... that title no longer belongs to me, and it never will again. I must step away from the adoring gazes and become a nameless guardian. To that end, I've been revisiting the survival skills I once learned during my days roaming the hills. Oh, do you think you could help me come up with a new knight's name?

Voices.Title: Chat: I
Voices.Content: Haultir is my sword and my very first companion. In the stories passed down in Egla Town, every true knight always has a sword they hold dear, so when I got mine, I was overwhelmed with joy. Though I've wielded many swords since, Haultir remains the most precious. Every time I grip the hilt, I can feel… that my heart hasn't changed. Even if it was a heart born from lies, I know that, when given the choice, I will always choose "to save."

Voices.Title: Chat: II
Voices.Content: I was born from the <te href=850074>Threnodian</te>'s curse and malice. It made me wear the crown, bathe in the glory of the Blessed Maiden, surrounded by the reverence of countless faithfuls. I fought against Its false faith, day after day, until I was finally overwhelmed by the tides... In that long slumber, those familiar prayers no longer felt warm, but cold and sorrowful. At one point, I thought I'd never want to hear them again. But after you saved me from the tower, I secretly visited <te href=850097>Ragunna</te> City… Oh, then I knew, I've never resented the prayers of those longing for happiness. And to ensure these pure voices aren't twisted, there's still much I need to do, and can do.

Voices.Title: About Cantarella
Voices.Content: I… took away the brilliant future she was meant to have. The future of being the <te href=850083>Sentinel</te>'s true Blessed Maiden. All the goodwill and hopes placed upon me, and the power I now possess… all of it should have belonged to Cantarella. Yet, she never seemed bothered by it. Someone as mature as her must have already found her own path within the <te href=850094>Fisalia</te> family. But still, I'll always remember that I owe her so much… so much.

Voices.Title: About Phoebe
Voices.Content: That girl has a kind and gentle heart. Duties aside, she always does her best to be there for others. Honestly, when it comes to knowledge of the Order's doctrines, I'm nowhere near as good as Phoebe. It's because of so many true and faithful believers like her, I find it difficult to reveal the truth to the people of <te href=850097>Ragunna</te>. People turn to faith for many reasons, not just out of devotion to the <te href=850083>Sentinel</te>. To unveil such unsettling truths would bring forth countless difficult choices and challenges...

Voices.Title: About Carlotta
Voices.Content: As the daughter of <te href=850101>Montelli</te>, she has really brought fresh ideas to the city. If this island were to stay isolated, the air would grow stifling. The people of <te href=850097>Ragunna</te> need new ships, new horizons, and new discoveries. I'm not very skilled in business matters, though. My nanny in the Order always said I didn't even know how to haggle... If I ever get the chance, I'd love to learn a few tricks from Miss Carlotta!

Voices.Title: About Ciaccona
Voices.Content: When I was a child, I used to beg the bards passing through town to sing me stories of knights. After I was freed from the tower, I wandered through a field one day, and the wind carried a piece of beautiful music to me. I stood beneath a tree in the distance, listening as Ciaccona sang a new poem, one with the melody of Egla Town's folk songs… In the blink of an eye, noon had already given way to dusk.

Voices.Title: About Lupa
Voices.Content: The nature of the <te href=850074>Threnodian</te>'s power to converge often makes me appear dangerous and unsettling after battle, but Lupa has never once recoiled. She never treats me as more or less than I am, and she has never distanced herself. She is honest, tenacious, and unwavering in her care of her friends. Even though I'm shorter than her when not in my Fleurdelys form, I still feel that I should take on the role of the "older sister" in our friendship.

Voices.Title: Birthday Wishes
Voices.Content: Happy Birthday, {PlayerName}! You're probably wondering why I brought you here. Just look at the clouds, the soaring birds, the Inverted Tower, and the golden glow of the morning sun... As long as you hold my hand, I can guide you to float above the sea like this. It's fascinating, isn't it? Later, when the sun sinks into the ocean, the view will be even more mesmerizing. I used to stare at this every day from the tower, and I grew weary of it. But now, everything feels different, all because of you. I'm not the true Maiden. I don't have the power to grant blessings, but I still want to offer you my best wishes. May your heart's deepest desire come true.

Voices.Title: Idle: I
Voices.Content: Today's story is... the great battle between a righteous knight and the wicked <te href=850074>Threnodian</te>! The victor is—Cartethyia the Knight!

Voices.Title: Idle: III
Voices.Content: Time for a little nap... It's... It's just a dream...

Voices.Title: Self-Introduction
Voices.Content: Cartethyia, now a wandering knight. The <te href=850074>Threnodian</te>'s malicious creation, the Order's unsuspecting <te href=850103>Laureate</te>, the defier lost in the tides of fate... These titles, once portrayed in poems and books, have long since slipped from my grasp. As for what lies ahead... let’s explore it together,  "Swordbearer."

Voices.Title: Greeting
Voices.Content: The crown of winds... has been engulfed by the sea. Tell me, are you the one who summoned this blade?

Voices.Title: Join Team: II
Voices.Content: This sword shall follow your will.

Voices.Title: Ascension: I
Voices.Content: My swordsmanship has reached new heights!

Voices.Title: Ascension: II
Voices.Content: Can you feel it? The frequency of the wind... it's resonating between us.

Voices.Title: Ascension: III
Voices.Content: During my studies at the seminary, I knew that to uphold justice, I would need to work harder and sacrifice more than others to overcome the shadows that sought to destroy it.

Voices.Title: Ascension: IV
Voices.Content: The power within me once terrified me. I wondered how monstrous I'd become if it consumed me... But such terrors have started to fade, with you by my side.

Voices.Title: Ascension: V
Voices.Content: The currents of fate pull everything into their depths. At times, as I drift in its grasp, I sometimes feel resistance. Everything I once achieved, every ounce of trust I earned, was consumed by the <te href=850074>Threnodian</te>. How ironic that the power I gained to protect others once served to sustain my nemesis. But I know I cannot let this fear hold me back. The <te href=850083>Sentinel</te> granted me life, and I must honor that blessing by guarding all that remains in Their stead.

Voices.Title: Hit: II
Voices.Content: If it's a duel you want...

Voices.Title: Injured: III
Voices.Content: This sword... shall not be shattered!

Voices.Title: Injured: IV
Voices.Content: A mere scratch upon my blade.

Voices.Title: Echo Transform: II
Voices.Content: What form do you look for?

Voices.Title: Sensor
Voices.Content: My knightly instinct says... this way!

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: I
Voices.Content: Just like the treasure chests from the stories!

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: II
Voices.Content: This should afford us more provisions.

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: III
Voices.Content: Let's call it... A Knight's Great Harvest.

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: IV
Voices.Content: What is it you wish for?

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: VI
Voices.Content: Your wish for wealth is granted.

Goods.Title: Worn Wooden Sword
Goods.Content:
A small wooden stage prop sword. Even the quiet countryside of Egla Town wasn't untouched by <te href=850096>Rinascita</te>'s popular stage plays. Spinning windmills and brilliant knightly legends shaped Cartethyia's childhood. This wooden sword was a gift from a retired dramatist. Each day after her lessons, she would patrol the village with bright eyes and high spirits, brandishing it as she dealt with every "injustice" she encountered.

This should have been the start of her journey to becoming a wandering knight.

Fate is full of what should have been, but it never unfolds as we imagine.

Goods.Title: Golden Laurel
Goods.Content:
A small golden <te href=850103>Laurel</te>.

When the golden crown was placed upon her head, the Divinity's whispers reached her ears for the first time.
From that moment on, she was no longer Cartethyia. She would become <te href=850096>Rinascita</te>'s Blessed Maiden, the "Fleurdelys" spoken of by all.

Fate can be too kind at first, only to become a rain that never stops falling.

Goods.Title: Hand Puppets
Goods.Content:
Hand puppets locked in a scuffle.

She had searched the tower for what felt like forever, yet found no trace of another soul. So she made puppets, staging play after play, just to keep from forgetting how to speak, and to fill the silence of being alone.

She missed the plays she had seen in the world of the living, missed the wheat fields of the countryside, missed sweet drinks and the sounds of people laughing.

Fate can fill us with nostalgia, even as it sends us onward alone.

SpecialCook.Name: Knight-Errant's Essentials
SpecialCook.Desc: Grants 34% Healing Bonus to all Resonators in the team for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.

Skill.Name: Sword to Carve My Forms
Skill.Desc:
<size=40><color=Title>Basic Attack - Cartethyia</color></size>
Perform up to 4 consecutive attacks, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color>.
Following <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Cartethyia</color> Stage 4, inflict 1 stack of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> on targets hit and summon <color=Highlight><te href=850186>Sword of Divinity's Shadow</te></color>.
Up to 1 <color=Highlight><te href=850186>Sword of Divinity's Shadow</te></color> may exist at the same time, lasting for 20s.
 
<size=40><color=Title>Heavy Attack - Cartethyia</color></size> 
Consume STA to attack the target, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and summoning <color=Highlight><te href=850185>Sword of Discord's Shadow</te></color>. Can be performed in mid-air.
Up to 1 <color=Highlight><te href=850185>Sword of Discord's Shadow</te></color> may exist at the same time, lasting for 20s.
This instance of DMG is considered <color=Highlight>Basic Attack DMG</color>.

<size=40><color=Title>Mid-air Attack - Cartethyia</color></size>
Release <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> button while airborne to perform Plunging Attack at the cost of STA, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color>, also considered <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> DMG.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after the <color=Highlight>Plunging Attack</color> to perform <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Cartethyia Stage 2</color>.
Casting <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Cartethyia</color> recalls all <color=Highlight>Sword Shadows</color>. Based on the types and number of <color=Highlight> Sword Shadows</color> recalled, perform different forms of Plunging Attack and obtain the corresponding <color=Highlight><te href=850181>Heart of Virtue</te></color>, <color=Highlight><te href=850182>Mandate of Divinity</te></color>, and <color=Highlight><te href=850183>Power of Discord</te></color>.

<size=40><color=Title>Dodge Counter - Cartethyia</color></size>
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} Normal Attack shortly after a successful <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> to attack the target, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color>.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Basic Attack - Cartethyia</color></size>
Deal <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and inflict <color=Wind>Aero Erosion</color> on the target. Summon <color=Highlight>Sword Shadow II</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Heavy Attack - Cartethyia</color></size>
Deal <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and summon <color=Highlight>Sword Shadow I</color>.
This instance of DMG is considered <color=Highlight>Basic Attack DMG</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Mid-air Attack - Cartethyia</color></size>
Deal <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and recall all <color=Highlight>Sword Shadows</color>.
This instance of DMG is also considered <color=Wind>Aero Erosion DMG</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Dodge Counter - Cartethyia</color></size>
Deal <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color>.

Skill.Name: Sword to Bear Their Names
Skill.Desc:
<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Skill - Cartethyia</color></size>
Attack the target, launch nearby enemies, and then plunge them to the ground, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and inflicting 2 stacks of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> on the targets hit. This instance of DMG is considered <color=Highlight>Basic Attack DMG</color>. Can be performed in mid-air.
Following <color=Highlight>Cartethyia - Resonance Skill</color>, summon <color=Highlight><te href=850184>Sword of Virtue's Shadow</te></color>.
Up to 1 <color=Highlight><te href=850184>Sword of Virtue's Shadow</te></color> may exist at the same time, lasting for 20s.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Skill - Cartethyia</color></size>
Deal <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and inflict <color=Wind>Aero Erosion</color> on the target. Summon <color=Highlight>Sword Shadow III</color>.
This instance of DMG is considered <color=Highlight>Basic Attack DMG</color>.

Skill.Name: A Knight's Heartfelt Prayers
Skill.Desc:
<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Liberation - A Knight's Heartfelt Prayers</color></size>
By reducing HP to 50% of the Max HP, <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color> transforms into <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>, unlocking new moves and entering the <color=Highlight>Manifest</color> state for 12s.
Can be performed in mid-air.
Entering <color=Highlight>Manifest</color> clears all <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color>.
As <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>, <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 5</color>, <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 2</color>, and <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - May Tempest Break the Tides</color> instantly trigger 1 instance of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> DMG and reduce the <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> stack on the target hit by 1.
- Ending the state will not clear Resonance Energy.
- No HP cost when HP is below 50%.

<color=Highlight>Fleurdelys's</color> attacks restore <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> on hit. When <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> reaches 120 points, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} Resonance Liberation to cast <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color>.

When <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> is below 120 points, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} Resonance Liberation to transform back into <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color>. When in <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>, casting <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - A Knight's Heartfelt Prayers</color> as Cartethyia consumes no Resonance Energy.

When <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> has <color=Highlight><te href=850181>Heart of Virtue</te></color> in <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>:
- <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 4</color> will generate a force field to Stagnate the targets within the range.
- <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys's</color> resistance to interruption increases. 
<color=Highlight><te href=850181>Heart of Virtue</te></color> is removed when <color=Highlight>Manifest</color> ends.

When <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> has <color=Highlight><te href=850182>Mandate of Divinity</te></color> in <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>: 
<color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> DMG is Amplified by 50% and the damage interval is decreased by 50% for enemies within a certain distance from <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>.
<color=Highlight><te href=850182>Mandate of Divinity</te></color> is removed when <color=Highlight>Manifest</color> ends.
 
When <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> has <color=Highlight><te href=850183>Power of Discord</te></color> in <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>:
When casting <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 5</color>, <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 2</color> and <color=Highlight>Enhanced Heavy Attack - Fleurdelys</color> or after <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - May Tempest Break the Tides</color> deals damage, raise the <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> stacks on all nearby targets to the highest count among the targets.
<color=Highlight><te href=850183>Power of Discord</te></color> is removed when <color=Highlight>Manifest</color> ends.
 
<color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> will transform back to <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color> during <color=Highlight>quest dialogues</color>, <color=Highlight>environmental interaction animations</color>, or using <color=Highlight>Utilities</color>.
<color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> can walk on water. Doing so on deep waters continuously consumes STA. When in walking state, <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> can step out of a high place and walk in mid-air by continuously consuming STA.
 
<size=40><color=Title>Avatar - Cartethyia</color></size>
As <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>, when <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> is below 120 points, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} Resonance Liberation to perform <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Cartethyia Stage 2</color> and temporarily transform back to <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color>, which pauses the timer on <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>.
Can be cast in mid-air. Casting the skill in mid-air performs <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Cartethyia</color>.
 
<size=40><color=Title>Avatar - Fleurdelys</color></size>
When in <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>, casting Resonance Liberation as <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color> performs <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 2</color> without consuming Resonance Energy and transforms her back to <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>, which resumes the timer on <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>.
Can be cast in mid-air. Casting this skill in mid-air performs <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 1</color>.

<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color></size>
When <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> has 120 points of <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color>, <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - A Knight's Heartfelt Prayers</color> is replaced by <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color>.
Casting <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color> removes all <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color>, ends <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>, restores 50% of Max HP, and then deals <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> to all targets in an area along a straight line in front. Upon hitting the target, remove all stacks of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> on the target. Each stack removed Amplifies the DMG taken by the targets by 20%, up to 5 stacks.
Can be cast in mid-air.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Liberation - Cartethyia</color></size>
At the cost of HP, transform into <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> and enter <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>, during which certain attacks immediately trigger <color=Wind>Aero Erosion</color> DMG.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Manifest</color></size>
When in <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>, <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> gains the following effects corresponding to the different types of <color=Highlight>Sword Shadow</color> recalled.
- <color=Highlight>Sword Shadow I</color>: Certain attacks propagate the highest stacks of <color=Wind>Aero Erosion</color> on targets hit to all nearby targets.
- <color=Highlight>Sword Shadow II</color>: The damage interval of <color=Highlight>Aero Erosion</color> DMG is reduced and the <color=Highlight>Aero Erosion</color> DMG taken by the target is Amplified.
- <color=Highlight>Sword Shadow III</color>: Certain attacks Stagnate the enemy. Gain increased resistance to interruption.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Liberation Finisher </color></size>
Restore HP and deal a massive amount of <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color>.

31-2.Name: A Knight's Heartfelt Prayers Resonance Cost

37.Name: A Knight's Heartfelt Prayers Concerto Regen

38.Name: Blade of Howling Squall Concerto Regen

Skill.Name: A Heart's Truest Wishes
Skill.Desc: The healing received by all Resonators other than <color=Highlight>Cartethyia/Fleurdelys</color> in the team is increased by 20% and their resistance to interruption is enhanced. If Rover: Aero is in the team, Rover: Aero additionally restores 25 <color=Highlight>Windstrings</color> upon casting <color=Highlight>Omega Storm</color>.
Skill.SimpleDesc: The healing received by Resonators in the team is increased and their resistance to interruption is enhanced. If Rover: Aero is in the team, Rover: Aero restores extra <color=Highlight>Forte Gauge</color> upon casting <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation</color>.

Skill.Name: Wind's Indelible Imprint
Skill.Desc: Targets with 1 to 3 stacks of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> take 30% more DMG from <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color> and <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>. Targets with more than 3 stacks of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> additionally take 10% more DMG from <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color> and <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> for each stack of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> they have, up to 3 stacks.
Skill.SimpleDesc: DMG dealt is Amplified according to the stacks of <color=Wind>Aero Erosion</color> on the target.

Skill.Name: Sword to Mark Tide's Trace
Skill.Desc:
<size=40><color=Title>Cartethyia - Sword to Mark Tide's Trace</color></size>
Deal Aero DMG and inflict 2 stacks of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> on targets hit. Summon <color=Highlight><te href=850185>Sword of Discord's Shadow</te></color>.
Up to 1 <color=Highlight><te href=850185>Sword of Discord's Shadow</te></color> may exist at the same time, lasting 20s.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after <color=Highlight>Cartethyia - Sword to Mark Tide's Trace</color> to perform <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Cartethyia Stage 2</color>.
 
<size=40><color=Title>Fleurdelys - Sword to Call for Freedom</color></size>
Thrust forward to impale the target, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and restoring <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color>.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys - Sword to Call for Freedom</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 2</color>.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Intro Skill - Cartethyia</color></size>
Deal <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and inflict <color=Wind>Aero Erosion</color> on the target. Summon <color=Highlight>Sword Shadow I</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Intro Skill - Fleurdelys</color></size>
Deal <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color>.

9.Name: Sword to Mark Tide's Trace DMG

22.Name: Sword to Call for Freedom DMG

23.Name: Sword to Mark Tide's Trace Concerto Regen

24.Name: Sword to Call for Freedom Concerto Regen

Skill.Name: Tempest
Skill.Desc:
<color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color> unlocks new moves when she transforms into <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>:

<size=40><color=Title>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys</color></size> 
<color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Cartethyia</color> is replaced by <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys</color>.
Perform up to 5 consecutive attacks, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and restoring <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> on hit.

<size=40><color=Title>Mid-air Attack - Fleurdelys</color></size> 
<color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Cartethyia</color> is replaced by <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Fleurdelys</color>.
Perform up to 3 consecutive attacks in the air at the cost of STA, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and restoring <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> on hit.
While airborne, hold <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 3</color>.
Follow up with <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> shortly afterward to cast <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 3</color>.
While airborne, casting <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - Sword to Answer Waves' Call</color> and <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - May Tempest Break the Tides</color> resets the cycle of <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Fleurdelys</color>.

<size=40><color=Title>Heavy Attack - Fleurdelys</color></size>
<color=Highlight>Heavy Attack - Cartethyia</color> is replaced by <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack - Fleurdelys</color>.
Thrust forward to deliver a focused strike, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and restoring <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> on hit. This instance of DMG is considered Basic Attack DMG.

<size=40><color=Title>Enhanced Heavy Attack - Fleurdelys</color></size>
While casting <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack - Fleurdelys</color>, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> again to cast Enhanced <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack - Fleurdelys</color>: fall back and blast the area in a straight line in front, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and restoring <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> on hit. This instance of DMG is considered Basic Attack DMG.
Follow up with <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> shortly after casting <color=Highlight>Enhanced Heavy Attack - Fleurdelys</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Upward Cut - Fleurdelys</color>.

<size=40><color=Title>Upward Cut - Fleurdelys</color></size>
While <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> is on the ground, <color=Highlight>Jump</color> to cast this skill, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and restoring <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> on hit.

<size=40><color=Title>Dodge Counter - Fleurdelys</color></size> 
<color=Highlight>Dodge Counter - Cartethyia</color> is replaced by <color=Highlight>Dodge Counter - Fleurdelys</color>.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} Normal Attack shortly after a successful Dodge to attack the target, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and restoring <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> on hit.
Follow up with <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> shortly afterward to cast <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 4 </color>.

<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Skill - Sword to Answer Waves' Call</color></size> 
<color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - Cartethyia</color> is replaced by <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - Sword to Answer Waves' Call</color>.
Summon a force field near the target's location to continuously pull in nearby targets, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> and restoring <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> on hit.
Can be cast in mid-air.

<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Skill - May Tempest Break the Tides</color></size>
Following <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - Sword to Answer Waves' Call</color>, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> again to call down a giant Sword Shadow to crush an area around the target, creating a force field to pull in nearby targets, dealing <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> to ground targets, and restoring <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> on hit.
Follow up with <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> shortly afterward to cast <color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 3</color>.
The Resonance Skill enters cooldown if <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - May Tempest Break the Tides</color> is not cast within a certain period or when switching to another Resonator. 
Can be cast in mid-air.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Fleurdelys</color></size>
Transform into <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> and unlock new moves.
When in <color=Highlight>Manifest</color>, <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color> is able to freely transform between herself and <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Forte Gauge</color></size>
As <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>, attacks restore <color=Highlight>Forte Gauge</color>.
When <color=Highlight>Forte Gauge</color> is full, <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation Finisher</color> is available.

28.Name: Sword to Answer Waves' Call DMG

28-2.Name: Sword to Answer Waves' Call Concerto Regen

29.Name: May Tempest Break the Tides DMG

29-2.Name: May Tempest Break the Tides Concerto Regen

Skill.Name: Wind's Divine Blessing
Skill.Desc: <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> dealt by the active Resonator in the team other than <color=Highlight>Cartethyia/Fleurdelys</color> to targets with <te href=850180>Negative Statuses</te> is Amplified by 17.5% for 20s.
Skill.SimpleDesc: <color=Wind>Aero DMG</color> dealt by other active Resonators in the team to targets with <color=Highlight>Negative Statuses</color> is Amplified.

Skill.Name: Tune Break: Sword
Skill.Desc: When the target's <color=Highlight>Off-Tune Level</color> is full. Deal <color=Highlight><te href=100001>Tune Break</te></color> DMG.
Skill.SimpleDesc: When the target's <color=Highlight>Off-Tune Level</color> is full

1.Name: Crown Destined by Fate
1.Desc:
Gain <color=Highlight>Zeal</color> that lasts for {0}s when <color=Highlight>Cartethyia's</color> or <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys's</color> attacks directly damage and defeat targets inflicted with <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color>.
In the <color=Highlight>Zeal</color> state, upon defeating enemies, the next move that directly damages targets raises the <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> stacks on the targets to the highest count among the targets defeated. This will not exceed the current max <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> stack limit. <color=Highlight>Zeal</color> is removed afterward and enters a {1}s cooldown.
When <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys's</color> <color=Highlight><te href=850179>Conviction</te></color> hits 30/60/90/120, <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys's</color> Crit. DMG is increased by {2} for {3}s, up to 4 stacks. The duration of this effect does not reset upon gaining new stacks. After casting <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color>, the increased Crit. DMG is removed.

2.Name: Blade Broken by Tempest
2.Desc:
Casting <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - A Knight's Heartfelt Prayers</color> increases the max stack limit of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> on targets within a certain range by <SapTag=0>{0}</SapTag> {Cus:Sap,S=stack P=stacks SapTag=0}. The next attack that directly damages the target inflicts <SapTag=1>{1}</SapTag> {Cus:Sap,S=stack P=stacks SapTag=1} of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> on all targets within a certain range and immediately triggers the <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> DMG on the targets hit once without consuming the <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> stacks.
The DMG Multipliers of <color=Highlight>Cartethyia's</color> Basic Attack, Heavy Attack, Dodge Counter, and Intro Skill are increased by {2} and the DMG Multiplier of her Mid-air Attack is increased by {3}.
After casting <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Cartethyia</color>, every 1 type of Sword Shadow recalled reduces the cooldown of <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - Cartethyia</color> by 1s.

3.Name: Prisoner Hanged in the Tower
3.Desc:
<color=Highlight>Basic Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 5</color>, <color=Highlight>Mid-air Attack - Fleurdelys Stage 2</color>, <color=Highlight>Enhanced Heavy Attack - Fleurdelys</color>, and <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - May Tempest Break the Tides</color> now inflict <SapTag=0>{0}</SapTag> {Cus:Sap,S=stack P=stacks SapTag=0} of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> on the targets hit.
The DMG Multiplier of <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill - Blade of Howling Squall</color> is increased by {1}.

4.Name: Sacrifice Made for Salvation
4.Desc: After Resonators in the team inflict <color=Highlight><te href=850012>Havoc Bane</te></color>, <color=Highlight><te href=850011>Fusion Burst</te></color>, <color=Highlight><te href=850008>Spectro Frazzle</te></color>, <color=Highlight><te href=850013>Electro Flare</te></color>, <color=Highlight><te href=850010>Glacio Chafe</te></color>, or<color=Highlight><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color>, all Resonators in the team gain {0} DMG Bonus for all Attributes for {1}s.

5.Name: Hope Reshaped in Storms
5.Desc:
When <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color> or <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> takes a fatal blow, they will not be downed by this instance of damage, but instead gain a Shield equal to {0} of <color=Highlight>Cartethyia's</color> Max HP for {1}s. This effect can be triggered once every 10 min.
The HP cost for casting <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - A Knight's Heartfelt Prayers</color> is reduced to {2} of Max HP.

6.Name: Freedom Found in Storm's Wake
6.Desc:
After casting <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color>, raise the <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> stacks on the target hit to max. Casting <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color> no longer removes the <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> stacks on the target.
Within {0}s after casting <color=Highlight>Intro Skill - Sword to Mark Tide's Trace</color>, <color=Highlight>Intro Skill - Sword to Call for Freedom</color>, <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - A Knight's Heartfelt Prayers</color>, and <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color>, when any Resonator in the team inflicts <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> on the targets with max stacks of <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color>, immediately trigger the <color=Wind><te href=850009>Aero Erosion</te></color> DMG once.
The targets take {1} more DMG from <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>.

81001409.Name: Cartethyia
81001409.BgDescription: The dress Cartethyia wore during her coronation as the Blessed Maiden. These thorns accompanied her through storms of solitude, and they serve to engrave the responsibilities of "salvation" deep into her heart.

140901.Desc: Enhanced <color=Highlight>Plunging Attack</color>: As <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color>, when there is at least 1 <color=Highlight>Sword Shadow</color> on the field, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} {0} while airborne.

140902.Desc: <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> Resonance Skill Stage 2: {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} {0} following <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> Resonance Skill Stage 1.

140903.Desc: <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> Enhanced Heavy Attack Stage 2: Hold {0} and then {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} {0} again.

140904.Desc: Temporarily transform back to <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color>: As <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} {0} when <color=Highlight>Conviction</color> is below 120 points.

140905.Desc: <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color>: As <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} {0} when <color=Highlight>Conviction</color> reaches 120 points.

DescList: As <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color>: The last Stage of Basic Attack, Heavy Attack, Intro Skill, and Resonance Skill of <color=Highlight>Cartethyia</color> will summon different <color=Highlight>Sword Shadows</color>. When there are <color=Highlight>Sword Shadows</color> on the field, <color=Highlight>Cartethyia's</color> Plunging Attack will recall the <color=Highlight>Sword Shadows</color> and cause additional DMG based on the Sword Shadows recalled.

When <color=Highlight>Cartethyia's</color> Resonance Energy is full, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} Resonance Liberation to transform into <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color> and obtain different bonus effects for a certain period of time based on the <color=Highlight>Sword Shadows</color> recalled.

As <color=Highlight>Fleurdelys</color>: Attacks restore <color=Highlight>Conviction</color>. When <color=Highlight>Conviction</color> reaches 120 points, <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation - Blade of Howling Squall</color> becomes available.
